pageContext.claim: “We had a tremendous deficit with them. And we're slowly eating away at these deficits.”
pageContext.analysis: The (sightly) revised trade deal with South Korea was signed in September, 2018. Since then the goods trade deficit has increased, not declined. The U.S. always had a substantial services surplus with South Korea , so the overall trade deficit was not "massive." It was $5.8 billion in 2018.
